    • Method Detail

      • getAll

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getAll(User loggedInUser)
        Returns All the Histories in the Database depending on the Role of the User. ADMIN: Can get ALL the Users. ELSE: UNAUTHORIZED
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The user who logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity with the list of Histories.

      • getById

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getById(User loggedInUser,
                                                       Integer id)
        Returns the History with the requested ID filtered by Role. Only those users can access the history who works in the same company as the Creator of the history, and who works at one of the companies of the Order to which the History belongs to. (Plus ADMINS) ADMIN: Can get ALL DIRECTOR, MANAGER: Can get Data if works in the same company as the Creator of the history, and also works at one of the companies of the Order to which the History belongs to. ELSE: UNAUTHORIZED Non existing History: NOTFOUND
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The user logged in
        id - The ID of the History the user wants to GET
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity of the History with the requested History filtered by Role.

      • putById

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity putById(History historyToUpdate,
                                                       User loggedInUser,
                                                       Integer id)
        Updates the History by ID. ADMIN: Can save any of the Histories. DIRECTOR, MANAGER: Only can update data if the user works in the same company as the Creator of the history, and also works at one of the companies of the Order to which the History belongs to. ELSE: UNAUTHORIZED Non existing History: NOTFOUND
        Parameters:
        historyToUpdate - The history with the information to update.
        loggedInUser - The user logged in.
        id - The ID of the History the user wants to PUT (Update).
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity of the updated History.

      • addHistory

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity addHistory(History historyToSave,
                                                          User loggedInUser)
        Creates a new record of History. ADMIN: Can add new Histories without any regulations. DIRECTOR, MANAGER: Only can add History if the user works in the same company as the Creator of the history, and also works at one of the companies of the Order to which the History belongs to. ELSE: UNAUTHORIZED
        Parameters:
        historyToSave - The history with the information to save.
        loggedInUser - The user logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity of the saved History.

      • deleteById

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteById(Integer id,
                                                          User loggedInUser)
        Deletes History record by ID. ADMIN: Can delete any Histories without any regulations. DIRECTOR, MANAGER: Only can delete History if the user works in the same company as the Creator of the history, and also works at one of the companies of the Order to which the History belongs to. ELSE: UNAUTHORIZED Non existing History: NOTFOUND
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the History the user wants to DELETE.
        loggedInUser - The user logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResponseEntity: OK if the deletion was successful and NotFound if the record was not found.
